data.name: Victory Cup
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Swalot

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.text: If, before doing damage, your opponent's Active Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than this Pokémon, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.flavorText: It swallows anything whole. It sweats toxic fluids from its follicles to douse foes.

abilities.name: Energy Protection
abilities.text: Any damage done to Metapod by attacks is reduced by 10 for each Energy attached to Metapod. You can't reduce more than 30 damage in this way.

data.name: Malamar

attacks.name: Eerie Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Random Peck
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Gazing at its luminescent spots will quickly induce a hypnotic state, putting the observer under Malamar's control.

data.name: Absol

abilities.name: Cursed Eyes
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may move 3 damage counters from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of his or her Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mach Claw
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: It appears when it senses an impending natural disaster. As a result, it was mistaken as a doom bringer.

data.name: Prinplup

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.

data.name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Alolan Golem-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Super Electromagnetic Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Heavy Rock-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any cards from their hand during their next turn. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Sonic Scream
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Parasect

attacks.name: Sleep Drain
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. Remove 4 damage counters from Parasect.

data.flavorText: The larger the mushroom on its back grows, the stronger the mushroom spores it scatters.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Natural Cure
abilities.text: When you attach an Energy card from your hand to Roserade C, remove all Special Conditions from Roserade C.

attacks.name: Magical Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and remove 2 damage counters from Roserade C.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coin. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Blitzle

attacks.name: Delivery Dash
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Electropower cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

data.name: Brionne

attacks.name: Disarming Voice
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards it enemies.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Shuppet and put it onto Shuppet. (This counts as evolving Shuppet.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Machop
data.flavorText: Though small in stature, it is powerful enough to easily heft and throw a number of Geodude at once.

data.name: Woobat

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

data.name: Pupitar

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.

data.name: Dark Machoke

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. Do the damage to the new Defending Pokémon. This attack can't be used if your opponent has no Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Knock Back
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: While normally peaceful and friendly, the number of incidents involving cruel Machokes is rising.

data.name: M Tyranitar-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

ancientTrait.name: θ Double
ancientTrait.text: This Pokémon may have up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Destroyer King
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Decidueye

abilities.name: Deep Forest Camo
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon V and Pokémon-GX.

attacks.name: Splitting Arrow
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: As if wielding a bow, it launches the arrow quills hidden among the feathers of its wings. Decidueye's shots never miss.

data.name: Zubat

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Even though it has no eyes, it can sense obstacles using ultrasonic waves it emits from it mouth.

data.name: Blitzle
data.flavorText: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.

data.name: Alomomola
data.flavorText: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.

data.name: Wailmer
data.flavorText: It swims along with its mouth open and swallows down seawater along with its food. It sprays excess water out of its nostrils.

abilities.name: Sleep Pendulum
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Hypno is your Active Pokémon, you may make the Defending Pokémon Asleep. This power can't be used if Hypno is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Spiral Aura
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon isn't Knocked Out by the damage from this attack, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch the Defending Pokémon with it.

data.name: Growlithe
data.flavorText: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

data.name: Dark Dragonair

abilities.name: Evolutionary Light
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for an Evolution card. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Dark Dragonair is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Tail Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

data.flavorText: As is fitting for a legendary Pokémon, it has many strange powers, including the ability to make rain or snow fall.

attacks.name: Stretch Vine
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Carnivine.

attacks.name: Vine Extract
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned.

data.name: Manectric

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.

data.name: Wartortle

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It is a well-established symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.

data.name: Tapu Koko-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Aero Trail
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may move any number of Lightning Energy from your other Pokémon to this Pokémon. If you do, switch this Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tapu Thunder-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Grotle

attacks.name: Planting
attacks.text: Attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: The shell is hardened soil. Some Pokémon come to peck the berries growing on the trees on its back.

data.name: Kingler

attacks.name: Heavy Pincers
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Claw Rend
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: The large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Electabuzz.

attacks.name: Thunder Spear
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Tynamo
data.flavorText: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

data.name: Frost Rotom

abilities.name: Roto Motor
abilities.text: If you have 9 or more Pokémon Tool cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in the attack cost of each of this Pokémon's attacks.

attacks.name: Frost Crush
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

abilities.name: Energy Connect
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Benched Pokémon and attach it to your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Ampharos is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Ampharos. If you do, this attack's base damage is 80 instead of 40.

data.name: Lanturn

abilities.name: Hydroelectric Power
abilities.text: You may make Floodlight do 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lanturn, but not used to pay for Floodlight's Energy cost. This power can't be used if Lanturn is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Floodlight
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea's surface from a depth of over three miles.

abilities.name: Natural Cure
abilities.text: When you attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Grovyle, remove all Special Conditions from Grovyle.

data.name: Huntail

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Dangerous Bite
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: It lives deep in the sea. With a tail shaped like a small fish, it attracts unsuspecting prey.

data.name: Cascoon

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if Cascoon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Cascoon if that damage is 30 or less.

attacks.name: Gooey Thread
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It is hot inside its cocoon. All the cells in its body create the energy for it to evolve.

data.name: Heliolisk

attacks.name: Volt Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.

data.name: Tapu Fini-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aqua Ring
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Shot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Tapu Storm-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle your opponent's Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their deck. If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Nidoqueen

attacks.name: Double Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Its entire body is armored with hard scales. It will protect the young in its burrow with its life.

attacks.name: Granite Head
attacks.text: Damage done to Shelgon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance) during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Dark Pupitar
rules: This Pokémon is both Fighting Darkness type.

attacks.name: Dark Streak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

data.name: Bulbasaur

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Bulbasaur.

data.flavorText: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. Thus, a plant sprouted and now grows with this Pokémon.

data.name: Hitmonlee

attacks.name: One-Two Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Heel Drop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It has a perfect sense of balance and can lash out with powerful kicks from any position.

abilities.name: Clear Body
abilities.text: Metang can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Extra Comet Punch
attacks.text: During your next turn, Extra Comet Punch does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Ursaring

attacks.name: Headpress
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

attacks.name: Double Lariat
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Although it is a good climber, it prefers to snap trees with its forelegs and eat fallen berries.

data.name: Double Magma Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to Team Magma Pokémon. Discard this card at the end of the turn you attached it.
This card provides FightingFighting Energy only while it is attached to a Team Magma Pokémon.
(If this card is attached to anything other than a Team Magma Pokémon, discard this card.)

abilities.name: Dual Armor
abilities.text: As long as Magcargo has any Fighting Energy attached to it, Magcargo is both Fire and Fighting type.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Extra Flame
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Random Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thundering Hurricane
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.

data.name: Swanna

attacks.name: Healing Dance
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Incessant Peck
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

data.name: Diancie

attacks.name: Sparkling Wish
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Diamond Storm
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Fairy Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.

data.name: Wartortle

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Aqua Slash
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: When tapped, this Pokémon will pull in its head, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.

data.name: Drednaw

attacks.name: Vise Wave
attacks.text: If you played Nessa from your hand during this turn, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey.

data.name: Dodrio

abilities.name: Retreat Aid
abilities.text: As long as Dodrio is Benched, pay Colorless less to retreat your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Dodrio.

data.flavorText: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.

data.name: Pokémon Center
rules: Remove all damage counters from all of your own Pokémon with damage counters on them, then discard all Energy cards attached to those Pokémon.

data.name: Galarian Mr. Mime

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Triple Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Its talent is tap-dancing. It can also manipulate temperatures to create a floor of ice, which this Pokémon can kick up to use as a barrier.

data.name: Charmeleon

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flare Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a Fire Energy attached to Charmeleon and this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: In the rocky mountains where CHARMELEON live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.

data.name: Altaria

abilities.name: Fight Song
abilities.text: Your Dragon Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Iron Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Stantler

attacks.name: Terrorize
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, choose 1 of its attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Overhead Toss
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to 1 of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Those who stare at its antlers will gradually lose control of their senses and be unable to stand.

data.name: Snorunt
data.flavorText: It feeds mainly on ice and snow. It's only able to survive in a limited number of places in the warm Alola region.

data.name: Blitzle

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use their flashing manes to communicate with one another.

data.name: Unown [I]

abilities.name: ITEM
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown I, Unown T, Unown E, and Unown M on your Bench, you may search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 ITEM Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Choose an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon and put it face down. Treat that card as a Special Energy card that provides Colorless Energy and doesn't have any effect other than providing Energy. Put that card face up at the end of your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

data.name: Minun

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Exposure to electricity from Minun and Plusle promotes blood circulation and relaxes muscles.

data.name: Barbaracle

attacks.name: Rock Rush
attacks.text: Discard as many Fighting Energy cards as you like from your hand. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.

data.flavorText: When they evolve, two Binacle multiply into seven. They fight with the power of seven Binacle.

data.name: Nidoking

abilities.name: King's Palace
abilities.text: Your Nidoqueen's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Power Lariat
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Evolution Pokémon on your Bench.

data.flavorText: One swing of its mighty tail can snap a telephone pole as if it were a matchstick.

data.name: Alolan Golem

attacks.name: Electromagnetic Rock Wrecker
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Heavy Slam
attacks.text: This attack does 30 less damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: It fires rocks charged with electricity. Even if the rock isn't fired that accurately, just grazing an opponent will cause numbness and fainting.

attacks.name: Sleep Seed
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Altaria

abilities.name: Fight Song
abilities.text: Your Dragon Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.

data.name: Golbat

abilities.name: Sneaky Bite
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swoop Across
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Once it bites, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

data.name: Slugma

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn't keep moving, its body will cool and harden.

data.name: Dark Muk

abilities.name: Sticky Goo
abilities.text: As long as Dark Muk is your Active Pokémon, your opponent pays ColorlessColorless more to retreat his or her Active Pokémon. This power stops working while Dark Muk is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sludge Punch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Muks appear suddenly, spreading sludge everywhere. Whenever one appears in a city, panic ensues.

data.name: Zekrom

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Storm Blade
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Night Attack
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Plusle

attacks.name: Tag Draw
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 4 cards. If Minun is on your Bench, draw 4 more cards.

attacks.name: Positive Ion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.

data.name: Milotic

abilities.name: Bright Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Milotic has provided inspiration to many artists. It has even been referred to as the most beautiful Pokémon of all.

data.name: Wailord
data.flavorText: They eat so many fish Pokémon that when Wailord become too numerous, fishermen have to chase them off.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Bewear-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bear Hug
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Double Impact
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Big Throw-GX
attacks.text: Discard your opponent's Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Goldeen
data.flavorText: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.

data.name: Cherrim

attacks.name: Worry Seed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Magical Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage and remove 3 damage counters from Cherrim.

data.flavorText: It blooms during times of strong sunlight. It tries to make up for everything it endured as a bud.

data.name: Pokémon Catcher
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Sneasel

attacks.name: Flash Claw
attacks.text: Your opponent discards a card from his or her hand.

data.flavorText: It feeds on eggs stolen from nests. Its sharply hooked claws rip vulnerable spots on prey.

data.name: Ledian

attacks.name: Baton Pass
attacks.text: If you have any Grass Pokémon on your Bench, remove all Grass Energy cards from Ledian and attach them to 1 of those Pokémon, then switch Ledian with that Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When the stars flicker in the night sky, Ledian flutters about, scattering a glowing powder.

data.name: Nidoran ♂

attacks.name: Hit Back
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has no damage counters on it, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.

data.name: Drifloon

attacks.name: Transfer Pain
attacks.text: Move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: These Pokémon are called the "Signpost for Wandering Spirits." Children holding them sometimes vanish.

data.name: Machoke

attacks.name: Last-Chance Chop
attacks.text: If this Pokémon's remaining HP is 10, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: It happily carries heavy cargo to toughen up. It willingly does hard work for people.

data.name: Regirock-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Regi Power
abilities.text: The attacks of your Fighting Pokémon (excluding Regirock-EX) do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Bedrock Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Quilava

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Quilava.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon is fully covered by nonflammable fur. It can withstand any kind of fire attack.

data.name: Wobbuffet

attacks.name: Counter
attacks.text: If an attack damages Wobbuffet during your opponent's next turn (even if Wobbuffet is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, Wobbuffet attacks the Defending Pokémon for an equal amount of damage.

data.flavorText: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.

attacks.name: Poison Spray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Poison Reaction
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Helioptile

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.

data.name: Blastoise-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rocket Splash
attacks.text: Shuffle any amount of Water Energy from your Pokémon into your deck. This attack does 60 damage for each card you shuffled into your deck in this way.

attacks.name: Giant Geyser-GX
attacks.text: Attach any number of Water Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Unown [B]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Bear]
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon with Unown in its name to Unown [B]. This power can't be used if Unown [B] has 10 HP left. This power can be used even if Unown [B] is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

data.name: Haunter

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: You can't use this attack unless the Defending Pokémon is Asleep.

data.flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

data.name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Self-Destruct
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges Thunder Wave and so on from the units at its sides.

data.name: Zebstrika

attacks.name: Disconnect
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Lightning Crash
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

data.name: Sableye

attacks.name: Bewitching Eyes
attacks.text: Choose a Supporter card from your opponent's discard pile and use it as the effect of this attack.

attacks.name: Furtive Drop
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It dwells in the darkness of caves. It uses its sharp claws to dig up gems to nourish itself.

data.name: Dusclops

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Trick Room
attacks.text: If you have a Stadium card in play, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If your opponent has a Stadium card in play, remove 2 damage counters from Dusclops.

data.flavorText: Its body is hollow. It is said that those who look into its body are sucked into the void.

data.name: Galarian Mr. Rime

abilities.name: Screen Cleaner
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to all of your Pokémon that have Energy attached. (Existing effects are not removed.)

attacks.name: Triple Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It's highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.

data.name: Nickit

attacks.name: Filch
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.

data.name: Gorebyss

attacks.name: Deflecting Splash
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Evolution Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its swimming form is exquisitely elegant. With its thin mouth, it feeds on seaweed that grows between rocks.

data.name: Altaria-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bright Tone
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX.

attacks.name: Sonic Edge
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Euphoria-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. Heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Tapu Fini-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aqua Ring
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Shot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Tapu Storm-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle your opponent's Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into their deck. If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Cloyster

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Cloyster by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Spine Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. For each heads, choose an opponent's Pokémon in play and this attack does 20 damage to those Pokémon. (You may choose the same Pokémon more than once.) (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Electabuzz from your hand onto Elekid (this counts as evolving Elekid) and remove all damage counters from Elekid.

attacks.name: Gather Energy
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Dark Wartortle

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Mirror Shell
attacks.text: If an attack does damage to Dark Wartortle during your opponent's next turn (even if Dark Wartortle is Knocked Out), Dark Wartortle does an equal amount of damage to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon with a negative attitude, it hides in its shell whenever it's in a bad mood—which is often.

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.text: Any damage done to Miltank by attacks from Fire Pokémon and Water Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Healing Milk
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Ducklett

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

data.name: Tropical Tidal Wave
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, discard all Trainer cards your opponent has in play. If tails, discard all Trainer cards (excluding Supporter cards) you have in play.

data.name: Nidorino

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Quick to anger, it stabs enemies with its horn to inject a powerful poison when it becomes agitated.

attacks.name: Flickering Flames
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Xurkitree

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Cablegram
attacks.text: If you have exactly 3 Prize cards remaining, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. It raided a power plant, so people think it energizes itself with electricity.

data.name: Aron

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: When it evolves, it sheds the steel carapace that covered its whole body and develops a new one.

data.name: Farfetch'd
data.flavorText: The plant stalk it holds is its weapon. The stalk is used like a sword to cut all sorts of things.

data.name: Kangaskhan

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets the baby out to play only when it feels safe.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Tail Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

data.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: The stronger electromagnetic waves from the three linked Magnemite are enough to dry out surrounding moisture.

data.name: Arctozolt

abilities.name: Biting Whirlpool
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both are tails, this attack does nothing. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Trevor
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Caterpie

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

data.name: Aipom

attacks.name: Tail Code
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tail Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It lives atop tall trees. When leaping from branch to branch, it deftly uses its tail for balance.

attacks.name: Shove
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Slap Down
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Fast Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Evolution cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Dark Weezing
rules: This Pokémon is both Grass Darkness type.

abilities.name: Methane Leak
abilities.text: As long as Dark Weezing is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each Pokémon that remains Poisoned between turns.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Darkness Charge
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on Dark Weezing.

data.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Circle Circuit
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.

data.name: Blitzle

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use their flashing manes to communicate with one another.

data.name: Cryogonal

attacks.name: Ice Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.

data.name: Swoobat

attacks.name: Phat Sound
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.

data.name: Emolga

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.

data.name: Regirock

abilities.name: Regi Cycle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have a Fighting Energy card in your discard pile, you may discard 2 cards from your hand. Then, attach a Fighting Energy card from your discard pile to Regirock. This power can't be used if Regirock is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Stone Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its entire body is made of rock. If any part chips off in battle, it attaches rocks to repair itself.

data.name: Emolga

attacks.name: Energy Catch
attacks.text: Put 3 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Volt Switch
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Lightning Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It glides using its cape-like membrane. Electrical energy scatters from it, shocking its friends and foes alike.

data.name: Froslass

attacks.name: Spiteful Sigh
attacks.text: Put up to 7 damage counters on this Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter you placed in this way.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It freezes hikers who have come to climb snowy mountains and carries them back to its home. It only goes after men it thinks are handsome.

attacks.name: Deflector
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever Erika's Exeggcute takes damage, divide that damage in half (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects still happen.)

attacks.name: Egg Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing to the Defending Pokémon and Erika's Exeggcute does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Zebstrika

attacks.name: Raid
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Blitzle during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

data.name: Munna

attacks.name: See Through
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears before people and Pokémon who are having nightmares and eats those dreams.

data.name: Manaphy

attacks.name: Deep Currents
attacks.text: Shuffle 5 Water Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.

data.name: Pelipper

attacks.name: Water Ball
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Pelipper.

data.flavorText: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokémon and eggs to safety in its bill.

attacks.name: Reckless Bomb
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Electrode G does 100 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to Electrode G to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Blitzle

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use their flashing manes to communicate with one another.

data.name: Gorebyss

attacks.name: Sweet Temptation
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to the new Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic Snap
attacks.text: If Gorebyss has any Psychic Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It lives at the bottom of the sea. In the springtime, its pink body turns more vivid for some reason.

data.name: Thundurus

attacks.name: Raging Thunder Punch
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Lightning Slam
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Lightning Slam during your next turn.

data.flavorText: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

data.name: Exeggutor

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch Exeggutor with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.

data.name: Ursaring

attacks.name: Bad Temper
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon's attacks do 60 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Defensive Claw
attacks.text: If Teddiursa is on your Bench, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage. If Teddiursa is on your Bench and has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage plus 40 more damage and remove all damage counters from that Pokémon.

data.flavorText: In its territory, it leaves scratches on trees that bear delicious berries or fruits.

data.name: Milotic

abilities.name: Sparkling Ripples
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Aqua Swirl
attacks.text: You may have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is the world's most beautiful Pokémon. There are many works of art featuring Milotic.

data.name: Ekans

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds such as Pidgey and Spearow whole.

data.name: Flareon

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Flareon.

data.flavorText: It stores some of the air it inhales in its internal flame pouch, which heats it to over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Nose Unit
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Poké-Bodies. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Loud Snort
attacks.text: Probopass G's Retreat Cost is 0 until the end of your next turn.

data.name: Eelektrik

abilities.name: Dynamotor
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.

data.name: Cramorant

attacks.name: Continuous Gulp Missile
attacks.text: Discard any number of Arrokuda from your Bench. This attack does 60 damage for each Arrokuda you discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: Cramorant's gluttony led it to try to swallow an Arrokuda whole, which in turn led to Cramorant getting an Arrokuda stuck in its throat.

attacks.name: Eerie Light
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: One-Two Strike
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Inkay

attacks.name: Rip Off
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent's will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.

data.name: Cascoon

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Cascoon and put it onto Cascoon. (This counts as evolving Cascoon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Thread
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It never forgets any attack it endured while in the cocoon. After evolution, it seeks payback.

data.name: Primarina

attacks.name: Disarming Voice
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sparkling Aria
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learning from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.

abilities.name: Emerge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for an Evolution card named Koga's Beedrill and put it on Koga's Kakuna. (This counts as evolving Koga's Kakuna.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Koga's Kakuna is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Toxic Secretion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

data.name: Houndour

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: When night falls, the air fills with the eerie cries of this Pokémon as it stakes out its territory.

abilities.name: Fluff
abilities.text: During your opponent's turn, if Jumpluff would be damaged or affected by an opponent's attack and it already has at least 1 damage counter on it, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack (including damage).

attacks.name: Cotton Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 times the number of heads.

data.name: Lucky Stadium
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Once during each player's turn (before attacking), that player may flip a coin. If heads, that player draws a card.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Jigglypuff from your hand onto Igglybuff (this counts as evolving Igglybuff), and remove all damage counters from Igglybuff.

attacks.name: Set Song
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and a basic Energy card, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Jolteon

attacks.name: Electrigun
attacks.text: You may discard a Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: If agitated, it uses electricity to straighten out its fur and launch it in small bunches.

data.name: Victini

abilities.name: Victory Star
abilities.text: Once during your turn, after you flip any coins for an attack, you may ignore all effects of those coin flips and begin flipping those coins again. You can't use more than 1 Victory Star Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Stored Power
attacks.text: Move all Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

abilities.name: Manipulate
abilities.text: When you play Gengar from your hand to evolve your Active Pokémon, you may put a Basic Pokémon (excluding Baby Pokémon) from your discard pile onto your Bench. Then, flip 3 coins. For each heads, choose a basic Energy card from your discard pile and attach it to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydrokinesis
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Delta Block
abilities.text: As long as any Stadium card with Holon in its name is in play, your opponent can't play any Stadium cards from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Mind Play
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose. If that card is a Trainer card, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage, and discard that card. If that card is not a Trainer card, return it to your opponent's hand.

data.name: Empoleon

abilities.name: Dignified Fighter
abilities.text: Each of your Basic Pokémon's attacks does 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Hydreigon

abilities.name: Dark Squall
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Darkness Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: There are a slew of stories about villages that were destroyed by Hydreigon. It bites anything that moves.

data.name: Arrokuda

attacks.name: Flock
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Arrokuda and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It's very proud of that jaw.

data.name: Voltorb

abilities.name: Destiny Burst
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, flip a coin. If heads, put 5 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It was discovered when Poké Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.

data.name: Beldum

attacks.name: Single Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: The magnetic force generated by its body repels the ground's natural magnetism, letting it float.

abilities.name: Shell Retreat
abilities.text: As long as Squirtle has any Energy cards attached to it, damage done to Squirtle by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Double Wing Attack
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Combusken

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its kicking mastery lets it loose 10 kicks per second. It emits sharp cries to intimidate foes.

data.name: Minun

attacks.name: Negative Ion
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 30 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Electrishower
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

data.name: Relicanth

attacks.name: Fossil Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Rare Fossil cards and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: The reason it hasn't changed at all in a hundred million years is that it's apparently already a perfect life-form.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Obscuring Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, shuffle Koga's Koffing and all cards attached to it into your deck (after doing damage).

data.name: Mew-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Versatile
abilities.text: This Pokémon can use the attacks of any Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's). (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

attacks.name: Replace
attacks.text: Move as many Energy attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

abilities.name: Energy Grounding
abilities.text: Once during your opponent's turn, when any of your Pokémon is Knocked Out by your opponent's attacks, you may use this power. Choose a basic Energy card discarded from the Knocked Out Pokémon and attach it to Lanturn. You can't use more than 1 Energy Grounding Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy attached to Lanturn. If you do, this attack's base damage is 90 instead of 50.

abilities.name: Crust
abilities.text: Any damage done to Heracross by attacks from your opponent's Basic Pokémon is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Get Even
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Prize card more than your opponent.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Double Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Raikou-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Thunder Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Volt Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Zebstrika

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: This ill-tempered Pokémon is dangerous because when it's angry, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.

data.name: Luvdisc

attacks.name: Even Game
attacks.text: Search your deck for a number of Basic Pokémon up to the number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and put those Pokémon onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Loving couples have a soft spot for this Pokémon, so honeymoon hotels often release this Pokémon into their pools.

data.name: Sneasel

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It feeds on eggs stolen from nests. Its sharply hooked claws rip vulnerable spots on prey.

data.name: Unown [Y]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Yield]
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Psychic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon with Unown in its name. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can be used even if Unown [Y] is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Fearow

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Fearow.

data.flavorText: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

data.name: Keldeo

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.

data.name: Duraludon V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Hard Coat
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Gatling Slug
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Potion
rules: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Poliwag

abilities.name: Round ‘n' Round
abilities.text: You can use this Ability only if you go second. Once during your first turn (before your attack), you may leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Confused.

data.flavorText: Despite the danger, it wants to come up on land. So it does its best to waddle along, but when an enemy finds it, it rushes back to the water.

data.name: Munna

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It eats the dreams of people and Pokémon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.

data.name: Riolu

attacks.name: Run Around
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions such as joy and rage in the form of waves.

data.name: Slowpoke

attacks.name: Spacing Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Scavenge
attacks.text: Discard a Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: It is always vacantly lost in thought, but no one knows what it is thinking about. It is good at fishing with its tail.

data.name: Yanma

attacks.name: Shockwave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance. Then, if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokémon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.

data.name: Dedenne

attacks.name: Entrainment
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Energy Short
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.

data.name: Granbull

attacks.name: Daunt
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Granbull.

data.flavorText: It is timid in spite of its looks. If it becomes enraged, however, it will strike with its huge fangs.

data.name: Emolga

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The energy made in its cheeks' electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.

data.name: Magnezone

attacks.name: Charge Beam
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Magnezone.

attacks.name: Metallic Bolt
attacks.text: You may discard a Lightning Energy and a Metal Energy attached to Magnezone. If you do, this attack's base damage is 120 instead of 60.

data.flavorText: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Drifloon

attacks.name: Blowing Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 of your Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Ominous Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and Pokémon. It loves damp, humid seasons.

data.name: Magmar
data.flavorText: It dislikes cold places, so it blows scorching flames to make the environment suitable for itself.

data.name: Charmander

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Charmander in order to use this attack.

data.flavorText: Obviously prefers hot places. If it gets caught in the rain, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

data.name: Emolga

abilities.name: Nuzzly Gathering
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Pokémon that has the Nuzzle attack, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It grills berries and bug Pokémon with electric shocks and makes a meal of them. It usually nests in the holes gouged in trees by Pikipek.

data.name: Donphan

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. You switch Donphan with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

attacks.name: Bash In
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 70 damage plus 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: It attacks by curling up, then rolling into its foe. It can blow apart a house in one hit.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Radiance
abilities.text: If Electrode is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Electrode is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Low Current
attacks.text: If Electrode was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Pidgeotto

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It renders its prey immobile using well-developed claws, then carries the prey more than 60 miles to its nest.

data.name: Holon's Castform
rules: You may attach this as an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon that already has an Energy card attached to it. When you attach this card, return an Energy card attached to that Pokémon to your hand. While attached, this card is a Special Energy card and provides every type of Energy but 2 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.)

attacks.name: Delta Draw
attacks.text: Count the number of Pokémon you have in play that has δ on its card. Draw up to that many cards.

data.name: Dewgong

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

attacks.name: Removal Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Ponyta

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Ponyta and put it onto Ponyta. (This counts as evolving Ponyta.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.

data.name: Geodude

attacks.name: Stone Barrage
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

data.name: Ekans

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Self Charge
attacks.text: Attach a Metal Energy card from your hand to Aron.

data.name: Jirachi

attacks.name: Diminutive Desire
attacks.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Doom Desire
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out at the end of your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It is said to have the ability to grant any wish for just one week every thousand years.

abilities.name: Flame Vapor
abilities.text: When you play Gyarados from your hand to evolve your Active Pokémon, you may flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon's Vengeance
attacks.text: If Gyarados has 7 or more damage counters on it, this attack's base damage is 100.

data.name: Spheal

attacks.name: Ball Roll
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Its body is covered in fluffy fur. The fur keeps it from feeling cold while it is rolling on ice.

data.name: Machamp

abilities.name: Badge of Discipline
abilities.text: The damage of each of your Fighting Pokémon's attacks isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Close Combat
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, during your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is increased by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.

data.name: Primarina-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bubble Beat
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Roaring Seas
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grand Echo-GX
attacks.text: Heal all damage from all of your Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sonic Signal
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Registeel

abilities.name: Regi Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard 2 cards from your hand. Then, remove 3 damage counters from Registeel. This power can't be used if Registeel is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Rotating Claws
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Registeel. If you do, search your discard pile for an Energy card (excluding the one you discarded) and attach it to Registeel.

data.flavorText: Tempered by pressure underground over tens of thousands of years, its body cannot be scratched.

data.name: Gible

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.

data.name: Bagon

attacks.name: Risky Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Dragon Eye
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: With its steel-hard stone head, it headbutts indiscriminately. This is because of the stress it feels at being unable to fly.

data.name: Snover

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Double Smash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.

data.name: Jigglypuff

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.text: All damage done to Jigglypuff during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: If puffs its body up like a balloon and sings a lullaby that makes all who hear it fall into a deep sleep.

data.name: Eelektross

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: A plan was recently announced to gather many Pikachu and make an electric power plant.

data.name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Electricity leaks from it in amounts far greater than the amount of electricity it eats.

data.name: Dark Persian

attacks.name: Fascinate
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. This attack can't be used if your opponent has no Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Popular with women because of its beautiful fur. The leader of the Rockets keeps one as a pet.

data.name: Drifblim

attacks.name: Eerie Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Burst Curse
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon. Put 8 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: It's drowsy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.

data.name: Espeon-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage times the number of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Divide-GX
attacks.text: Put 10 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Self-Destruct
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 80 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: A linked cluster formed of several Magnemite. It discharges powerful magnetic waves at high voltage.

data.name: Pokémon Tower
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
If the effect of a Pokémon Power, attack, Energy card, or Trainer card would put a card in a discard pile into its owner's hand, that card stays in that discard pile instead.

data.name: Goldeen

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.

data.name: Kyogre ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Frenzy
abilities.text: As long as your opponent has Groudon, Groudon ex, Rayquaza, or Rayquaza ex in play. Kyogre ex's attacks do 40 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Aqua Supply
attacks.text: You may attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tsunami
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Gastly

attacks.name: Ominous Eyes
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Should a strange light be seen flickering in an abandoned building, Gastly is lurking there.

data.name: Heliolisk

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Raging Thunder
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.
